CatDescriptText: Portion of article by Frederick Gray accompanying related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 30, 1946, pg. 3, reads: "Income Tax Man Served in 351st - Another cog in multi-colored wheel of Democracy is Paul C. Pollard of 2255 Webster Avenue, who is the only Negro auditor of the Income Tax Division, Bureau of Internal Revenue, United States Treasury Department of Pittsburgh. A graduate of Schenley High School, Pollard received a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration in June of 1941, from the University of Duquesne.  Shortly after graduation, he was inducted into the armed forces and served for four years.  Making his way up through the ranks, Pollard served the last eighteen months of his enlistment as a second lieutenant with the fames 351st Field Artillery Battalion of the Forty-Sixth Field Artillery Brigade.  A native Pittsburgher, Pollard is a married man and the proud father of two lovely children..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Paul C. Pollard wearing U. S. Army uniform with field artillery insignia on collar, posed in front of moire background, in Harris Studio
